name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Inn & Suites Rutland/Killington

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights this summer. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, friendly and accomodating. They even brought us a crib for our infant son, free of charge. Our suite had a very homey feel to it with a nice private patio. Beds were unbelievably comfortable with newly washed linen (not the typical hotel covers). Kitchen came equipped with pots, dishes, full size fridge, oven and gas ranges. Overall, very clean, very friendly, and reasonable too. We can't wait to return again soon!
reviews.title: Great experience, we'll be back!

likes.disliked: — bathroom was clean but had a bit of a smell

reviews.text: This location was part of a block for a local weekend. The bathroom was cleaner than I expected, and the staff really went above and beyond. This included setting up two 3:30 wake up calls because people frequently fall back to sleep. Parking was available right next to the buildings.
reviews.title: Nice place, nice staff...one caveat....

reviews.text: However-earplugs are strongly recommended. Even if the next room was vacant, dragging suitcases up and down the wooden staircases are close to deafening. This was in summer-I can't imagine the volume when snowboards are involved. The price was right and I would return, just plan accordingly.
reviews.title: Better than Good

reviews.text: The price is right here and it is so very clean. Even has the bedding that is all washed between guests. Very accommidating as we booked late for a two week stay but they were able to accomidate us by finding a suite for us. The suites are better than the rooms, however, unless you are going to be in the room a lot of the time the rooms are fine, and again very clean.
reviews.title: nice place to stay, great value

reviews.text: Breakfast is okay. Again, very clean area. Waffles are ready to be made, fresh fruit, choice of breads, muffins, bagels. I have been to other places that offer more but this is okay.
reviews.title: Clean but noisy

reviews.text: We had a problem with another hotel in Rutland and was referred to the Best Western after calling around to find vacancies. The staff was very helpful. We had a coupon for the Sunday night part of our stay and the room was only $53! Small room, but clean (2 double beds). Microwave and fridge were new. Pool wasn't open yet. Nice quiet location. Free breakfast was OK. Homey lodge-style lobby with newspapers, books, etc. We'll come back in the winter!!
reviews.title: Really good stay

reviews.text: We had gone to Vermont for our sons graduation and stayed at the Rutland Best Western. This Best Western seems to be converted from condominiums. The property was well manicured. Our suite was spacious, clean and quiet. The staff is friendly and courteous. Please take time to enjoy the complimentary breakfast buffet including a fresh hot waffle bar. They also have english muffins, bagels, bran, blueberry and corn muffins, cereals, fruit, coffee, tea juice, etc.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Safe bet and getting better!!
reviews.text: For three years we have stayed here. The rooms are being modernized so the stay is only getting better. The combination of - convenience to a choice of ski slopes (Killington 15 mins, Piko 5 mins, Okemo 40 mins and Sugar Bush 60 mins), price, comfort, good breakfast and convenience to Rutland facilities - make this place tough to beat. If you are looking for luxury then try other places.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few tips. Ask for accommodation on the ground floor. Carrying lots of luggage from the car up one flight of external stairs (including any ice that has collected) can be tiring. The mountain wall center just down the road is a lot of fun.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the Best Western in Rutland. We heard about the Manager's Special through another TA member (thank you) which is posted on the hotel website (bestwestern-rutland.com) and was able to reserve a room for at the "Best Available Rate" plus our 2nd night was free! Our room even came with a kitchen, so we were able to save even more by preparing our own meals. Good location and pleasant staff. We will definitely return.
reviews.title: Large and Comfortable

likes.disliked: — Close to highway - so you did hear the cars occasionally late at night

reviews.text: First off, I booked this hotel through priceline and got a very good rate. If I had paid full price I would have been very upset. The room was basic as was the bathroom. The towels werent very soft. We were in town to ski so we arrived and went right to sleep. They offer a complimentary breakfast. This is fine if you like waffles--otherwise you are out of luck as the choices are slim.
reviews.title: Skiing at Killington

reviews.text: Overall, it was acceptable, but I would probably choose elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Great hotel for Killington Skiers

reviews.text: Our family (4 people) stayed here over the Winter break from December 28 to Jan 2, 2009. We had a one bedroom suite with living room. The hotel met our needs perfectly. It had a living room with dining area and small kitchen along with the bedroom and bath. It gave us enough room to spread out in the evening and allowed us to stay in and cook on a couple of the nights there. The beds were comfortable and it was quiet. We took advantage of the complimentary breakfast each morning before heading out to Killington for skiing.
reviews.title: The 'BEST' Western

reviews.text: Tips for skiers - we took advantage of the advance purchase option on the Killington site to buy tickets and save money. We also rented skis from Peak Performance in Killington and reserved them on the web to get a discounted rate.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — Carrying heavy luggage up a flight of stairs--no first floor rooms were available.

reviews.text: We only found one really good place to eat out, which was Little Harry's. The Pasta Pot was OK if you are hungry and just looking for food.
reviews.title: Great family place

aka: Best Western Plus Inn & Suites Rutland/Killington Hotel Rutland
description: Rutland and Killington's best-kept secret. Located on 12+ acres of beautifully landscaped lawns, minutes to downtown Rutland and Killington Resort. 1 & 2 Bedroom spacious suites available for nightly or extended stays. Traditional rooms also available for the budget minded. Complimentary WiFi, Fitness Room and a Hot Breakfast included every day! Call for extended stay, corporate or government rates.
